text: The Great Seal of the State of Utah was adopted on April 3, 1896 at the first regular session of the Legislature (January, February, March, April 1896). The first seal was made by Harry Edwards and cost $65.00. ==The meanings of the symbols== Symbol Meaning American Eagle National bird Shield common defense Industry Motto Beehive State emblem 1896 Statehood established 1847 Pioneers (first settlers) arrived Sego Lily State flower American flags National Government ==Related pages== *Flag of Utah Category:Utah Utah Category:1896 establishments in the United States Category:19th-century establishments in Utah
title: Seal of Utah
